1.text: Remember, O Lord, what has befallen us. Consider and look kindly upon our disgrace.

2.text: Our inheritance has been turned over to foreigners; our houses to outsiders.

3.text: We have become orphans without a father; our mothers are like widows.

4.text: We paid for our drinking water. We acquired our wood for a price.

5.text: We were dragged by our necks. Being weary, no rest was given to us.

6.text: We have given our hand to Egypt and to the Assyrians, so that we may be satisfied with bread.

7.text: Our fathers have sinned, and are not. And we have carried their iniquities.

8.text: Servants have become rulers over us. There was no one to redeem us from their hand.

9.text: We obtained our bread at the risk of our lives, before the face of the sword, in the wilderness.

10.text: Our skin was burned, as if by an oven, before the face of the tempest of the famine.

11.text: They humiliated the women in Zion and the virgins in the cities of Judah.

12.text: The leaders were suspended by their hand. They were not ashamed before the faces of the elders.

13.text: They have sexually abused the adolescents, and the children were corrupted in the wood.

14.text: The elders have ceased from the gates, the youths from the choir of the psalms.

15.text: The gladness of our heart has failed, our singing has been turned into mourning.

16.text: The crown has fallen from our head. Woe to us, for we have sinned.

17.text: Because of this, our heart became gloomy; for this reason, our eyes have been darkened:

18.text: because of mount Zion, because it was ruined. Foxes have wandered upon it.

19.text: But you, O Lord, shall remain for eternity, your throne from generation to generation.

20.text: Why would you forget us forever? Why would you forsake us for a long time?

21.text: Convert us, O Lord, to you, and we shall be converted. Renew our days, as from the beginning.

22.text: But you have utterly rejected us; you are vehemently angry against us.
